channel.title: Converting on DNM Bible
channel.description: Recent content in Converting on DNM Bible

item.title: Litecoin to Monero/Bitcoin
item.description: Litecoin to Monero/Bitcoin Like it was mentioned before the fees that come with bitcoin have gotten higher and higher. Litecoin is a very similar coin to Bitcoin that you can start with and convert to Monero (recommended) and save yourself some money on the fees. Remember everything with Litecoin is also public, and can be tracked back to you. If you start with Litecoin you should always be converting to XMR.

item.title: Bitcoin to Monero/Litecoin
item.description: Bitcoin to Monero/Litecoin This chapter is going to focus on converting your current Bitcoin to Monero or Litecoin. Everything with Bitcoin can be viewed on the blockchain. If you started with Bitcoin that could be tied to your identity, or you want to convert your Bitcoin to Monero (recommended) start here. How you bought your coins does not matter when you follow this path to break the chain to your identity: For our example here we are going to use Elude and Kilos.

item.title: Monero to Bitcoin/Litecoin
item.description: Monero to Bitcoin/Litecoin Some vendors, or services do not accept Monero. If this is the case you will need to convert your coins to Bitcoin. Again once you have converted a few times you might want to try using a script to convert. More about scripts can be found on /d/Monero . Note: This chapter used to be written around using XMR.to, they have decided to shutdown. This chapter will now focus on using Elude and Kilos to also convert your coins back to bitcoin/Litecoin.

item.title: Crypto Closing Words
item.description: Crypto Closing Words In short this is the path you will follow. XMR Wallet->XMR.to->Bitcoin wallet->Market Note: After you convert make sure you use a new wallet that has not ever been tied to your identity. Wallets that send coins to markets can be labeled as “hot” you don’t want the two wallets to ever interact. If you started with Bitcoin, and need to pay in bitcoin here is an example of the path you follow: BTC Exchange-> BTC Wallet 1 -> Convert to XMR -> XMR Wallet-> Pay for your goods.
